      • clone

        public Heap<T> clone()
        Description copied from interface: Heap
        Generate a copy of this heap.

        Note:

        • Be sure to cast the return value to the proper Heap<T> type before use.
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Heap<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The return value is a copy of this heap. Subsequent changes to the copy will not affect the original, nor vice versa.
        See Also:
        Object.clone()

      • ensureCapacity

        public void ensureCapacity(int minimumCapacity)
        Change the current capacity of this heap.

        Postcondition:

        • This heap's capacity has been changed to at least minimumCapacity. If the capacity was already at or greater than minimumCapacity, then the capacity is left unchanged.
        Parameters:
        minimumCapacity - The new capacity of this heap.
        Throws:
        java.lang.OutOfMemoryError - Indicates insufficient memory for altering the capacity.

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Return the current capacity of this heap.

        Note:

        • The add method works efficiently (without needing more memory) until this capacity is reached.
        Returns:
        Returns the current capacity of this heap.

      • trimToSize

        public void trimToSize()
        Reduce the current capacity of this heap to its actual size (i.e., the number of elements it contains).

        Postcondition:

        • This heap's capacity has been changed to its current size.
        Throws:
        java.lang.OutOfMemoryError - Indicates insufficient memory for altering the capacity.
